21.title: BaltiCon Wrap-up
21.plot: Mike and Pete return from BaltiCon and they talk about all of the fun and cool things that went on.

22.title: Chasing the Dragon
22.plot: On this episode we interview Jayson Elliot, the editor-and-chief of Gygax Magazine. Prior to launching Gygax magazine with this partners Luke and Ernie Gygax, he was the editor of IndustrialnatioN magazine, and the founder and publisher of Permission magazine. He also co-founded and hosted the Roll For Initiative podcast.

23.title: Star Struck
23.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

24.title: Robot Uprising
24.plot: The MythWits are doing something a little different this week. Brian Gregory will be joining us to talk robots. Brian works with robots and while we'll be talking shop we're going to get a bit silly. Be prepared for a complete robotastic episode.

25.title: SDCC Benchwarmers
25.plot: Our guests could not make it but we had a great show anyway. We talked about Comic-Con, felt the rise of Darth Blix, and played Movie Poster Madness.

26.title: Dragon*Con Pre-Show
26.plot: Our annual Dragon*Con Pre-Show! Find out what to do and what not to do this year at the Dragon! We talked with Maria Walters producer of the Atlanta Star Party, David Simpson of Gamers on Games, Moshi of Moshi Moshi Productions, and Mark Baggett of Markstercon.

27.title: This Means War!
27.plot: On this Episode we welcome Jonathan Reinhart. He is an avid pod-caster and war game expert. He produces Wargaming Recon and Geeks Explicitly.

28.title: Cowabunga Dude!
28.plot: Tonight is a very special show. We welcome Steve Lavigne. Steve is an American comic book illustrator best known for his lettering and coloring on the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles title for Mirage Studios. He is also the basis for the character of Michaelangelo.

29.title: A-Kon Wrap-Up
29.plot: Brian and the Texas crew went to A-Kon. Here is your inside look.

30.title: Ready for Action
30.plot: This week we are joined by Duncan Rouleau and Joe Kelly of Man of Action! They have worked on just about everything from X-Men to Superman. They are probably best known for Ben 10 and Big Hero 6.

31.title: Dragon*Con Wrap Up
31.plot: Pete, Mike, and Allegriana went Dragon*Con!

32.title: Box Office Draft Wrap Up
32.plot: The Summer Movie Draft has come to an end. Brian, Mike, Pete, David, DeVon, and Ian talk about the race to the finish and their thoughts on this summer's movies.

33.title: Fade to Black
33.plot: A writer, pod-caster, and software architect from Houston, Texas, Paul E Cooley has been writing since the age of 12. In 2009, he began producing free psychological thriller and horror pod-casts, essays, and reviews available from Shadowpublications.com and iTunes.

34.title: Ebolapalooza
34.plot: This week we are joined by John Cmar, MD. John has been long enthralled with horrible infections that could spell doom for humankind, as well as sanity and skepticism in the practice of medicine. He works at a major hospital in Baltimore, MD, where he helps run the Division of Infectious Diseases as well as a residency program to train doctors in Internal Medicine. He also does Infectious Diseases outreach in Baltimore television and print media, and is the guest-in-residence on the monthly Midday on Health show with Dan Rodricks on 88.1 WYPR radio in Baltimore. John ...

35.title: Clash of the Geeks
35.plot: Michael R. Underwood is the author of Geekomancy, Celebromancy, Attack the Geek, and the forthcoming Shield and Crocus and The Younger Gods.

36.title: The Star Stryder
36.plot: We host the amazingly brilliant Pamela Gay. She's an astronomer, writer, and pod-caster focused on using new media to engage people in science and technology.

37.title: Viva LeVoit
37.plot: Violet LeVoit is the author of the short story collections "I am Genghis Cum" and "I'll Fuck Anything That Moves and Stephen Hawking". Her bizarro, horror, and erotic fiction has appeared in many publications including Psychos, Shock Totem, Imperial Youth Review, and The Magazine Of Bizarro Fiction. She's also a film critic and contributing writers for film blogs like Press Play and Film Threat, and writes regularly about the golden age of Hollywood for Turner Classic Movies. She describes her work as "Transhuman Gothic".

38.title: Winter Movie Draft
38.plot: This week the MythWits make their pledges for the Winter Movie Draft.

39.title: The Dungeon Crafter
39.plot: Stefan Pokorny is the founder and Chief Sculptor/artist at Dwarven Forge, makers of the world's finest miniature terrain for RPG's. His company has run 2 very successful Kickstarters of over 2 million dollars in funding each. Stefan has also done cartography works for Luke Gygax and Tim Kask. He is a sculptor and painter by trade who started Dwarven Forge in 1996 to earn extra money and who now finds himself overwhelmed and delighted by it's wide ranging audience and success. He is a professional Dungeon Master who runs games for cash in local bars and game stores and...

40.title: The Bishop Cometh
40.plot: Artist extraordinaire Ben Bishop joined to talk about his graphic novel work.

1.title: Chop Socky Jen
1.plot: For our Season 2 opener we welcome model and actress Jen Page. Jen Page grew up believing she could be Wonder Woman, Supergirl or a fairy mermaid astronaut queen. So far, she hasn't learned she was wrong. Jen spends her time acting, modeling, cosplaying, and writing. She also loves illustrating for RPGS and sewing fantastical costumes, like kraken bustles, dragon dresses and mermaid tails. She has starred in The Gamers: Dorkness Rising, Project London, Chop Socky Boom, to name a few.

2.title: Evolveolution
2.plot: Molecular Biologist, evolution educator, and atheist activist Dr. Zachary Moore of the popular podcast Evolution 101 will be joining us to school us on evolution. We will also be talking in length about the evolution of cancer research and where we are today with our understanding of cancer.

3.title: Zombified!
3.plot: On this prerecorded episode we were joined by Mark Rein-Hagen, a role-playing, card, video and board game designer. He is best known as the creator of Vampire: The Masquerade and the World of Darkness game Setting. His work on World of Darkness has influenced the movie-series Underworld, and True Blood. We also talked to him about his life in Hollywood, his game Democracy, and his newest game I Am Zombie.

4.title: From the Fringe
4.plot: On this episode we talk to John Reiher, a writer and game designer for Tri Tac Games. We go over the various games that Tri Tac has to offer such as Fringeworthy, Bureau 13, Incursion, Weird Zone, and Hard Wired Hinterland. We also talk about his work with the web site SciFi Ideas.

5.title: Bulldoggin' It
5.plot: Brennan Taylor is the president of Galileo Games and the designer of the role-playing games Bulldogs!, Mortal Coil, and How We Came to Live Here. He was also a co-founder of Indie Press Revolution, a small-press game publisher site. He used to host Voice of the Revolution, the official podcast of IPR.

6.title: Release the Krakens
6.plot: On this episode we are joined by Scott Sigler and A. Kovacs! New York Times best-selling author Scott Sigler is the creator of fifteen novels, six novellas and dozens of short stories. His works are available from Crown Publishing and Del Rey Books. He is also a co-founder of Empty Set Entertainment, which publishes his young-adult Galactic Football League series.

7.title: CyberWits Activate!
7.plot: The MythWits proudly welcome Mike Pondsmith to the show. Mike is the main man at RTalsorian Games. If you're a long time gamer you've seen and probably played at least one of his awesome games: Cyberpunk, Mekton, Fuzion, Champions New Millenium, Castle Falkenstein, or Teenagers From Outerspace. We talked a great deal about RTal history, future, and where he is with the Mekton Kickstarter.

8.title: Hart Attack
8.plot: This week we have the distinct pleasure of welcoming Jess Hartley. For more than a decade, Jess has been a fixture in the White Wolf landscape. From novels and game creation to editing and development, Jess has helped contribute to some of most popular products published in the World of Darkness, Exalted, and Scion game systems.

9.title: The Initiative
9.plot: Tee & Pip are award winning authors and pod-casters. They are about to release their fourth book in the A Ministry of Peculiar Occurrences series "The Diamond Conspiracy" and we'll talk a bit about that. However, they recently released "The Ministry Initiative RPG" and we'll mostly be focusing on that.

10.title: Fuck Cancer
10.plot: Zach Moore returns to talk with us about the current state of cancer research and a bit on the evolution of cancer over time.

11.title: The Mighty One
11.plot: One of the OG's of PodCasting Mur Lafferty joins the MythWits. She is known for her novels "Playing For Keeps" and "The Shambling Guide" series and for her podcast "I should be Writing".

12.title: Director X
12.plot: Writer, Producer and Director Francis Xavier was born and raised on the mean streets of Baltimore's Edmondson Village and spent a lot of his childhood in the projection room of the old Tower Theatre on Charles and Saratoga Streets. It was there, while his mother managed the place, that he became captivated with the movies that loomed larger than life on the big screen, and it was there that he made his first attempts at writing his own.

13.title: Lost Colony
13.plot: The MythWits interview entomologists Joe Ballenger of Ask an Entomologist and bee expert Dr. Yanega. The topic of discussion is colony collapse disorder (CCD) and what the most resent scientific research says about it.

14.title: The Blasphemous One
14.plot: The MythWits welcome one of their own to step out in front of the camera. When Steve Wollett isn't helping the MythWits with their IMDB page, he runs a very popular blog called Nerd Rage News. He has also published a few gaming supplements but most notably his most excellent drink book Blasphemous Cocktails. Plus Mike Kafes gets a special birthday present.

15.title: Summer Draft
15.plot: The MythWits compete in their annual summer movie draft

16.title: Meet Your Maker
16.plot: Brad Ruprecht is a 3D printing expert who works for an Army Rapid Prototyping facility. He schools us on 3D printing technology; where it's at and where it's going. Working daily on the cutting edge of this technology and with a multitude of the different printing systems, Brad knows 3D printing better than most. And he's going to show us his R2D2 that he built with mostly 3D printed parts.

17.title: Super Gamer
17.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

18.title: Feeling Swamped
18.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

19.title: No Justice
19.plot: The MythWits bring you the very best in geek pop culture. A weekly live video show, on-demand video channel, and audio podcast. Specializing in informative interviews and convention coverage all with a heavy dose of comedy.

20.title: The Dice Man
20.plot: David M. Ewalt studies games and technology. He is a contributing editor to Forbes Magazine, writes a blog for Forbes.com, and is author of the book Of Dice and Men: The Story of Dungeons & Dragons and The People Who Play It.

21.title: TSR Podcast Network
21.plot: On this episode we are going to talk about the new TSR Podcast Network. Two shows are about to launch and we've got the most in depth, inside look at those shows you're going to find anywhere. How can we be so sure? Because your host, Peter Bryant, is producing both of those shows. He invited two of his hosts, James Carpio and Chad Parish, to come on and talk about the shows.

22.title: Ground Control
22.plot: Streamed live on Jul 13, 2015 Jack Clemons is a former Lockheed Martin engineering executive and a degreed "rocket scientist". He was an engineer and team leader on NASA's Apollo and Space Shuttle Programs. He has given talks across the Mid-Atlantic region on the Apollo Moon Program, on the design and first flights of the NASA Space Shuttle, and on the subject of Why Science Matters. He also appeared in the "Command Module" segment of "Moon Machines," the Discovery Science Channel's award-winning six-part documentary about the Apollo Program. He's a published science ...

23.title: Stuff of Legends
23.plot: Streamed live on Jul 20, 2015 Jason Nelson started professional RPG writing in 2002 with the Save My Game and Behind the Screen gamemastering advice columns for Wizards of the Coast, then broadening into writing adventures for Dungeon ("Practical Magic" and "Man Forever") and several articles for Dragon. In 2008, he made the Final Four in Paizo's inaugural RPG Superstar competition, and since then has been a regular contributor to Paizo's Adventure Paths, including End of Eternity for Legacy of Fire, War of the River Kings for Kingmaker, and The Hungry Storm for Jade ...

24.title: The Gibbering Roche
24.plot: Streamed live on Jul 27, 2015 Some creatures feed on blood and revel in the screams of their prey. Scott Roche craves only caffeine and the clacking of keys. He pays his bills doing the grunt work no one else wants to take, bringing dead electronics back to life and working arcane wonders with software. His true passion is hammering out words that become anything from tales that terrify to futuristic worlds of wonder. All that and turning three children into a private mercenary army make for a life filled with adventure.

25.title: Euro Gaming
25.plot: This week we speak with Norbert Franz while traveling through time and discovering things that are dead but not yet dead or some other geeky strangeness. Plus an all new game.

26.title: Man at Arms
26.plot: Greg Paye is a professional instructor and coach of the Olympic sport of fencing. He was the Mid-Atlantic Senior Men's Epee ("ep-pay") champion in 2001. He is a certified Prevot ("pray-voh") with the US Fencing Coaches Association and has over 20 years of professional coaching experience. He owns and operates the Maryland Fencing Club in Abingdon, Maryland, about 20 minutes north of Baltimore.

27.title: The Praetorian
27.plot: The incredibly talented and entertaining artist and celebrity gamer Satine Phoenix joins us tonight. We're going to talk about her new comic book The New Praetorians and her newest podcast Game School.

28.title: Going Old School
28.plot: Michael Curtis has worked as a freelance writer and game designer since 2008. He has written or contributed to more than forty roleplaying games, supplements, and articles. Best known for Goodman Games' The Dungeon Alphabet (for which he was awarded the 2011 Three Castles Award for Game Design) and Stonehell Dungeon, he's also worked on the Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG, METAMORPHOSIS ALPHA, Goblinoid Games' Realms of Crawling Chaos and MAJUS, and Chapter 13 Press' Tales from the Fallen Empire. The author of many DCC RPG adventures including The Chained Coffin, The ...

29.title: GITAVO
29.plot: This week we are joined by Laura Nicole AKA The Gypsy Pirate who has been voice acting since 2005. From playing aliens to super villains, vampires to plucky side kicks, her range has stretched the a wide spectrum

30.title: Let's Get It On!
30.plot: On this episode the MythWits are joined by EWA wrestlers The Dark Horses. We're talking Wrastlin y'all.

31.title: Phoenix Commander
31.plot: This week we are interviewing Keith Baker, creator of Eberron and the new Dawn Phoenix Command.

32.title: Summer Draft WrapUp
32.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

33.title: Into the Game Hole
33.plot: On this episode we talk to Alex Kammer about Game Hole Con. Alex is the Director of Gamehole Con, the largest and most awesome tabletop gaming convention in the upper Midwest.

34.title: Blackout
34.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

35.title: Fungus Amungus
35.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Mythwits at the Movies
1.plot: It's our season 3 opener and the team is going to talk about the awesome year in movies we had in 2015. This is going to be a deep dive and will be full of spoilers. If you haven't seen Age of Ultron, Fury Road, Jurassic World, Star Wars, and Hateful 8, you might want to tune in when you have. We will do the movies in that order so you can always watch until we hit one you haven't seen yet. We'll also talk about all the changes the show has gone through while we've been off.

2.title: John Wick
2.plot: John Wick is an award winning game designer. He is best-known for his work on games such as Legend of the Five Rings, 7th Sea, Orkworld and Houses of the Blooded.

3.title: Into Exile
3.plot: We are joined this week by author of the Hyperion Empire series, Joshua Done.

4.title: Happy Happy Joy Joy
4.plot: The MythWits have the esteemed pleasure of welcoming the creator of Ren and Stimpy, the one and only... Bob Camp!

5.title: PodCast Ninjas
5.plot: This episode is mostly free form geekery. However, Ben Gerber returns as a special host and will be talking about his game Swamped and his new game Ninja, Silent but Deadly.

6.title: The Grim Reaper
6.plot: On this episode we are joined by James "Grim" Desborough. Known to be a rakish fop, gentleman bastard, and ten times more charming than that Arnold on Green Acres. James is a game designer, author, and blogger who has worked primarily on role-playing games, as well as card games, board games and social computer games.

7.title: Droning On
7.plot: On this episode we talking about drones. Harold Wylie works for the Army helping to pioneer new military uses for drones.

8.title: TotalCon2016
8.plot: Practical jokes, great games, and all around fun ensue as we explore Total Confusion 30.

9.title: Sound of Darkness
9.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

10.title: GaryCon 2016 Wrap-Up
10.plot: The MythWits went to GaryCon and had a friggin blast.

11.title: The Quest
11.plot: On this episode we talk to game designer Jason Anarchy of Drinking Quest.

13.title: Enter the EDverse
13.plot: On this episode the MythWits welcome Ed Greenwood to the show. Ed is a Canadian writer, game designer, and library guy best known for creating The Forgotten Realms. He has published more than 300 books that have sold millions of copies worldwide in more than 3 dozen languages. He sometimes looks like Santa Claus.

14.title: The Legend Continues
14.plot: The MythWits welcome back Legendary Games! They are promoting their new Kickstarter, Trail of the Apprentice. It's a Pathfinder & 5E saga for all ages.

15.title: Ground and Pount
15.plot: Rob Sullivan is a professional mixed martial artists from Baltimore MD. He is currently 6-3 coming off three straight wins. He also was the singer of the hardcore/punk band Ruiner who is reuniting this summer.

16.title: AkumaMatada
16.plot: This week we talk to Mike Mylar for a little bit about his Kickstarter Mists of Akuma. Finally we yammer on about DC Legends of Tomorrow, Superman v Batman, Hateful 8, and Dare Devil Season 2. We'll warn you when to turn off if you haven't seen one of these yet because we're spoiling the crap out of them. The MythWits bring you the very best in geek pop culture. A weekly live video show, on-demand video channel, and audio podcast. Specializing in informative interviews and convention coverage all with a heavy dose of comedy.

17.title: Savage Rifts
17.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

18.title: Malediction of Hans
18.plot: The MythWits welcome author Hans Cummings. He's the author of the Fantasy series: The Foundation of Drak-Anor and Scars of the Sundering as well as the Zack Jackson science fiction series. Two of his short stories appear in Fear the Boot's Sojourn speculative fiction anthologies. Hans is also a volunteer for the tabletop gaming industry ENnie Awards and serves as their Submissions Coordinator.

19.title: Beastmasters
19.plot: On this episode we welcome three of the Four Horsemen about their new Kickstarter, the Talented Bestiary. Steve Helt, aka Famine He's won two Iron GM World Championships and in 2013 was awarded the title of RPG Superstar by the fans and staff of Paizo Publishing. Since then, he's assembled a wicked cast of friends and fellow game designers who are designing and developing their way into tables everywhere. Adopting the office of Famine, Steve acts as business manager and creative director for the Four Horsemen and builds the brand as a full-time freelance designer and ...

20.title: Super Bad
20.plot: We're talking to Tee Morris and Pip Ballantine about past, present, and future work. Then we'll talk about bad super hero movies, and we might just play a new game. The MythWits bring you the very best in geek pop culture. A weekly live video show, on-demand video channel, and audio podcast. Specializing in informative interviews and convention coverage all with a heavy dose of comedy.

21.title: Moving to Mars
21.plot: On this episode, we're talking to Nicole Willett about the possibility of boots on Mars. Nicole serves as the Education Director and Steering Committee Member for the Mars Society, the world's largest humans to Mars advocacy group. Willett is a full time Astronomy instructor at Benedictine Military School in Savannah, Ga. She maintains an education website, education.mars society.org with regular blog entries, has written and contributed to many Ezines, books, and websites regarding Mars research and humans to Mars advocacy. Nicole helps to coordinate and organize the...

22.title: Balticon 2016
22.plot: The MythWits went to BaliCon and talk all about it. Then they spend a few minutes talking about Captain America: Civil war.

24.title: The Awakening
24.plot: Hal Greenberg Hal is a five-time ENnie nominated and winning game designer who is a partner. AD, designer and writer for Samurai Sheepdog. Hal has worked with many of today's leading writers and designers, including Monte Cook, Todd Lockwood, Ed Greenwood, Richard Lee Byers, and Tony Szczudlo. His current projects are The Awakened RPG, The Awakened anthologies (book II, III), Adventure In card game, Witching Hour card game and a female re-imagined version of the Three Musketeers called The Sisterhood of the Blade (anthology) as well as a few unannounced projects.

25.title: Rampage
25.plot: Matthias Bonnici of Lost Cog joins the MythWits to talk about his Kickstarter for Rampaging Jotunn. He sticks around to help us bring the funny! This was the Season 3 mid-season finale. Last chance to catch us live for a whole month. We pulled out a bunch of goodies we'b been saving up and this episode put the FU in funny!

28.title: Pony Up!
28.plot: We welcome David Silver to join us to talk about his Kickstarter Ponyfinder - Dawn of the Fifth Age. David is the guy that looked at a bunch of brightly colored ponies and decided he would put them in a real fantasy world. There are no rainbows to shield them from dark happenings and terrible forces beyond their control, or even their own petty desires. Fallen empires and ancient secrets give plentiful reasons for adventurers to exist, even if they happen to have four legs. He remains committed to this world and enjoys diverse role-playing options, as well as ...

29.title: Wild Manimals
29.plot: The Manimals marry party rock with poetry to produce raucous anthems and inspire sing-alongs and dancing wherever they go. A female-fronted, genre-bending five-piece, The Manimals bring to mind hints of David Bowie, Joan Jett, The New York Dolls, The Yeah Yeah Yeahs, and Blondie. Their ecstatic, cathartic live show is a throwback to the wild thrills of early punk rock, but with lyrical intensity and melodic heights rarely found in its modern iterations. Their vibrant and aggressive debut album, Born Strange, was released in 2012. SEVEN, a geeky glam-rock concept album...

30.title: Burn Baby Burn
30.plot: Luke was born to a dying people, raised by monsters, abandoned in the ruins of a once-great civilization. Despite this he managed to become an award-winning game designer and has designed excellent games like Burning Wheel, Mouseguard, and Torchbearer.

31.title: Mutant PaNik
31.plot: On this episode the MythWits have returning guest Nik Palmer. He's a game designer who's coming on to talk about his work and his first Kickstarter, the Mutant Manual.

32.title: Big Badda Bang
32.plot: The MythWits welcome theoretical astrophysicist Ethan Siegel. He loves writing long, glorious, illustrated articles that tell what we know about the Universe and how we know it. He's been writing the blog Starts With A Bang since 2008, currently at Forbes. He also writes a monthly column for NASA's The Space Place that appears in over 200 astronomy club newsletters worldwide. His very first book, "Beyond the Galaxy," is available from World Scientific. It tells the entire story of what the Universe is made of, how big it is, where it came from and what it's fate is, ...

33.title: Rocketman Mike
33.plot: On this very special episode the MythWits welcome astronaut Colonel Mike Mullane. Mike is an Aeronautical Engineer and was selected as a Mission Specialist in 1978 in the first group of Space Shuttle Astronauts. He completed three space missions aboard the Shuttles Discovery and Atlantis before retiring from NASA and the Air Force in 1990. He served America during the Vietnam War as a combat pilot flying 134 combat missions. He has been inducted into the International Space Hall of Fame and is the recipient of many awards, including the Air Force Distinguished Flying ...

34.title: 2016 Box Office Wrap Up
34.plot: We wrap up the 2016 Box Office Draft. Who won, who lost, who chose shit movies, who chose wisely? Find out tonight as the MythWits are joined by award winning author Paul E. Cooley and kick ass podcaster Sean Kelly.

35.title: Wild Wieand
35.plot: Charles is a comedian, daredevil, and internet personality. Charles is best known for his outdoor comedy, pranks, and absurd stunts, such as riding an inflatable toy crocodile into a pool of alligators and beekeeping without clothing. He has been seen in the news around the world. Charles has handled cobras, rattlesnakes, swam with sharks, jumped out of airplanes, and crawled on his belly though caves. He also performs stand-up comedy. Due to the pop culture nature of many of his pranks he often speaks at comic conventions and has funny interactions with celebrities.

36.title: Rise of the RoboCar
36.plot: Jack Ballard joins us to talk about driverless cars. Jack is one of the hosts of the Flex Mentallo podcast. The show where they yammer on every week about whatever random shit is on their minds. Everything from movies to politics to the latest facebook rage trend.

37.title: Bla Bla Bla
37.plot: No guest tonight so we went free form. We talked about Marvel vs DC, cool new shows, smoking weed on Mars, and a driverless cars follow-up. The MythWits bring you the very best in geek pop culture. A weekly live video show, on-demand video channel, and audio podcast. Specializing in informative interviews and convention coverage all with a heavy dose of comedy.

38.title: Game Time
38.plot: On this episode, we got our first video game review from Ian Kafes. We're played Mike's new game Kickstarter or Crapstarter, Bet the Geek, and MatchWits. We also talked to Magic 8-Bit. The MythWits bring you the very best in geek pop culture. A weekly live video show, on-demand video channel, and audio podcast. Specializing in informative interviews and convention coverage all with a heavy dose of comedy.

39.title: Cooking with Phasers
39.plot: Denise holds a BA in Biopsychology from Vassar College and an MA in Writing from Johns Hopkins University. She spent the first twenty years of her career as an executive in the technology industry before leaving the corporate world to devote her energies to the non-profit arena. Her fascination with culinary history has been shared at several science fiction conventions as an approach to world-building. She is a member of SFPA and her poetry has been published in journals, chapbooks, and anthologies. Her most recent book "The Culinary History of Southern Delaware" was...

40.title: LeVoit Noir
40.plot: We are excited to have Violet LeVoit back to talk about her new book "I miss the World." Set in and around Hollywood Forever Cemetery, this tense and mind-bending noir is Violet LeVoit at her finest: an unnerving, unpredictable and comic journey through deep trauma and glitzy nostalgic insanity.

88.title: Pikachu Choses Mike
88.plot: A practical joke of the Mythwits host, Mike Kafes. Filmed at Total Confusion 30

1.title: Bicameral Minds
1.plot: The MythWits return for Season 4. We talk about tips to look smarter in meetings, followed up by a discussion of consciousness and West World, and finish off with a game of SoundByte Madness.

2.title: Kilbane of Yore
2.plot: Best known for his three-year run on Fox's MADtv, Pat Kilbane made his mark on the show with outrageous physical comedy and uncanny celebrity impressions. Among his more memorable characters were Stan the Java Man, the shady Spishak spokesman, and the floppy superhero Rubberman. Kilbane's impressions are too numerous to list, but notably his mimicry of Howard Stern and Lyle Lovett fooled some viewers into believing that the stars actually appeared on the show. He has appeared in the films "Evolution," "Semi-Pro" and "Day of the Dead" and played the Anti-Kramer in the ...

imdb.title: Mythwits
plot: _Mythwits_ (qv) is a web series variety show that has celebrity interviews, geektastic games, and some of best humor on the Internet.
